New Records: Virat Kohli became the second India batter after Sachin Tendulkar to score 3000 runs in international cricket against South Africa.
Key Match Events: Kohli and Shreyas Iyer added 103 runs between themselves from 126 balls after Rohit Sharma and Shubman Gill fell quickly.
Pre-Game Insights: The article mentions the slow pitch at Eden Gardens and the need for Kohli and Iyer to stabilize the innings.
Post-Match Reflections: The article reflects on Kohli's performance and his historical achievements against South Africa.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Kohli's best score in Test cricket came against South Africa in 2019, and he also equaled Tendulkar's 6000-run milestone in ODIs.
Others: The match was part of the ODI World Cup 2023, and the article provides a live update on the scorecard and points table.
